identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Ianalumab Versus Placebo in Addition to First-line Corticosteroids in Primary Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-blind Study of Ianalumab (VAY736) Versus Placebo in Addition to First-line Corticosteroids in Primary Immune Thrombocytopenia (VAYHIT1)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of two different doses of ianalumab versus placebo in addition to first-line corticosteroids in maintaining platelet count ≥30 G/L in adult participants with primary ITP.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a multi-center, randomized, double-blind Phase 3 study to assess the efficacy and safety of two different doses of ianalumab compared to placebo in adults with primary ITP (platelets count \<30 G/L) who require first-line standard-of-care corticosteroids.

After completion of the screening period, the participants will enter the randomized treatment period (ianalumab/placebo with standard of care corticosteroids).

After the treatment period, all participants will enter the follow-up period to be monitored for efficacy and safety or safety only depending on how they respond to the study treatment.

armGroups.label: Ianalumab Lower dose
armGroups.description: Lower dose of ianalumab administered intravenously with corticosteroids oral or parental (if clinically justified)

armGroups.label: Ianalumab Higher dose
armGroups.description: Higher dose of ianalumab administered intravenously with corticosteroids oral or parental (if clinically justified)

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Placebo administered intravenously with corticosteroids oral or parental (if clinically justified)

interventions.name: Ianalumab
interventions.description: Intravenous infusion, prepared from concentrate solution

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Intravenous infusion, prepared from matching placebo

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time from randomization to treatment failure (TTF)
primaryOutcomes.description: Time from randomization until platelet count below 30 G/L, need for a rescue treatment or start of a second-line therapy or death.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Complete Response (CR) rate in each treatment group
secondaryOutcomes.description: Complete Response (CR) rate at each timepoint defined as the proportion of participants with any platelet count of at least 100 G/L in the absence of rescue treatment or new ITP treatment.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Response (R) rate in each treatment group
secondaryOutcomes.description: Response (R) rate at each timepoint defined as the proportion of participants with any platelet count of at least 50 G/L in the absence of rescue treatment or new ITP treatment.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to complete response in each treatment group
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from randomization to date of first complete response.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of response in each treatment group
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from achievement of complete response to loss of complete response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Stable response at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with at least 2 platelet count collected at month 6 (between study dates 107 and 183) and at least 66% of platelet counts qualified as a response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At 6 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Stable response at 1 year
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with at least 2 platelet counts collected at year 1 (between study days 296 and 379) and at least 66% of platelet counts qualified as a response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At 1 year

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of participants with bleeding events overall and by World Health Organization (WHO) bleeding scale severity
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is to assess the incidence and severity of bleeding in each treatment arm
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with bleeding events overall and by World Health Organization (WHO) bleeding scale severity
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is to assess the number and severity of bleeding in each treatment arm
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants receiving rescue treatment (cummulative dose/duration of steroids exposure)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is to assess the number of participants receiving rescue treatment.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of participants receiving rescue treatment (cummulative dose/duration of steroids exposure)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is to assess the need of rescue treatment in each treatment group by percentage.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cumulative dose/duration of steroids exposure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Duration of exposure to corticosteroids calculated from randomization (first dose) to end of study or last last contact date (if the participant is lost to follow-up).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From screening to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline on T scores of the PROMIS SF v1.0 Fatigue 13a
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Short Form v1.0 Fatigue 13a includes 13 items that assess fatigue
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From screening (baseline) till end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in ITP-PAQ domain scores
secondaryOutcomes.description: The ITP-PAQ is a 44 item scale for measuring HRQoL in adults with ITP across ten scales: Symptoms, Bother-Physical Health, Fatigue/Sleep, Activity, Fear, Psychological Health, Work, Social Activity, Women's Reproductive Health, and Overall QoL. Each item is rated on a Likert type scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From screening (baseline) till end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in frequency of CD19+ B cell counts
secondaryOutcomes.description: Post baseline frequency (%within the CD45) of CD19+ B cell counts compare to baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in absolute number of CD19+ B cell counts
secondaryOutcomes.description: Post baseline absolute number of CD19+ B cell counts compare with baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to first occurrence of B-cell recovery
secondaryOutcomes.description: B-cell recovery, defined as ≥80% of baseline or ≥50 cells/μL
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomized of last patient)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in inmmunoglobulins
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in immunoglobulin levels
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after last randomized patients)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: AUClast
secondaryOutcomes.description: AUClast: area under the curve from time zero till the last measurable concentration sampling time (tlast)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameter: AUCtau
secondaryOutcomes.description: Area under the curve calculated to the end of a dosing interval (tau)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: Cmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: Maximum (peak) observed plasma, blood, serum, or other body fluid drug concentration after single dose administration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: Tmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to reach maximum (peak) plasma, blood, serum, or other body fluid drug concentration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: Accumulation ratio Racc
secondaryOutcomes.description: Accumulation ratio calculated using AUC values obtained between the last and first dose
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of anti-ianalumab antibodies in serum (ADA assay) over time
secondaryOutcomes.description: Anti-drug antibodies (ADA) will be evaluated in samples collected from all participants assess the immunogenicity of ianalumab
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to Week 33

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Titer of anti-ianalumab antibodies in serum (ADA assay) over time
secondaryOutcomes.description: Anti-drug antibodies (ADA) will be evaluated in samples collected from all participants assess the immunogenicity of ianalumab
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to Week 33

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Signed informed consent prior to participation in the study.
* Male or female participants aged 18 years and older on the day of signing informed consent
* Primary ITP diagnosed within 3 months before initiating first-line ITP therapy (corticosteroids, IVIG)
* Platelet count below 30 G/L before starting any first-line ITP therapy (corticosteroids, IVIG)
* Response (platelet count \>=50 G/L) to corticosteroids (+/- IVIG) at any time prior to randomization. Note: Platelet count measured within 7 days of platelet transfusion will not be considered as response.

Key Exclusion Criteria:

* Evans syndrome or any other cytopenia (patients with anemia related to bleeding or iron deficiency are eligible)
* Current life-threatening bleeding
* Previous ITP treatment, including splenectomy, except for corticosteroids and/or IVIG initiated as first-line therapy for up to 28 days before randomization and rescue corticosteroids and/or IVIG given prior to confirmed diagnosis of primary ITP .
* Prior use of B-cell depleting therapy (e.g., rituximab).
* Absolute neutrophil count below 1.0 G/L at randomization
* Participants with concurrent coagulation disorders and/or receiving anti-platelet or anticoagulant medication with an exemption of low dose of acetylsalicylic acid

Other protocol-defined Inclusion/Exclusion may apply.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description:
Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations.

This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com
